content:
Deje sa to na účte GMAIL s prístupom IMAP. Mám dva účty. Prvý je v poriadku a druhý má od 10.3.2024 takýto problém. Z priečinka "Doručená pošta" mi dňa 10.3.2024 zmizla všetka pošta. Nedokázal som to vyriešiť. Keď som sa prihlásil k problémovému účtu cez vebové rozhranie, tak v priečinku "Doručená pošta" mám asi 800 emailov, no v Thunderbirde v priečinku "Doručená pošta" sa zobrazujú iba nové emaily iba od 10.3.2024 a v priečinku "Všetky správy" sú všetky správy cca 800 emailov. Nová pošta mi od 10.3.2024 u tohoto problémovému účtu dochádza stále do priečinka "Doručená pošta" a je tam aj všetka nová pošta od 10.3.2024 zobrazená. Nerozumiem tomu čo sa stalo.

Vyriešil som to tak, že som si všetku starú poštu od 10.3.2024 z priečinka "Všetky správy" prekopíroval do priečinka "Doručená pošta". Takže teraz ich mám všetky v "Doručená pošta" - cca 800 emailov a do tohoto priečinka mi prichádza aj všetka nová pošta. Dosiahol som stav taký, ako bol pred dátumom 10.3.2024.
creator: Ansamb

content: Děkuji za radu, ale zatím to nepomohlo. Do "Doručená pošta" se mi nepodařilo nic překopírovat (copy/paste, nebo přetažením řádku emailu ze složky "Všechny zprávy" do řádku "Doručená pošta" ). V doručené poště nic není ikdyž by v ní mělo být 453 emailů jak vypisuje v přehledu (viz obr.). Ale i to číslo je malé, protože "Všechny zprávy" vypisují 11717 celkem a z toho by nejméně polovina měla být doručená pošta. Další zajímavý fakt je ten, že když se na stejný účet přihlásím z mého notebooku, tak tam je všechno v pořádku, doručené emaály se objevují správně v "Doručená pošta". Dík za čas. DK
creator: dimikra

content: Kliknite na priečinok "Doručená pošta" pravým tlačidlom myši a vyberte "Vlastnosti" a potom kliknite na dlaždicu "Opraviť priečinok" a v ľavom spodnom rohu sledujte čo sa deje - mali by sa načítavať správy. Po pár minútach by ste mali mať v Thunderbirde načítaný priečinok "Doručená pošta" a zosúladený s priečinkom "Doručená pošta" na serveri.
creator: Ansamb

content:
If you are using a Thunderbird IMAP account then local settings with regard take a back seat to the server settings. So if you tell Thunderbird to never empty the trash and your server automatically does that after 10 days, that deletion from trash will be replicated in Thunderbird simply ignoring the local settings.

Likewise if you also use IMAP on your phone or other device and delete mail to recover used space on the device with the tiny storage that will be syncronised back to the server and hence to Thunderbird.

It is also a requirement as far as I understand the whole IMAP in Thunderbird thing that you periodically close Thunderbird and restart it. You also need to have the IMAP expunge on exit is account settings turned on to actually see per folder maintenance work.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: More info is needed. Is it that you have an email address account on Thunderbird and want to change it? Unless it is just a change of the email prefix, such as changing jane@aol.com to xxxx@aol.com, you are better served to create the new account separately. Is that your question? You want to import a contact list. Fine. In what format does that contact list reside? Do tell us more, and I'm sure someone here can assist. Thank you..
creator: davidsk

content: try setting incoming to outlook.office365.com, 993, ssltls, OAUTH2 and output to smtp.office365.com, 587, starttls, OAUTH2

content: Thanks, but that gives the same error even with entering my password again. Anything else I can try?
creator: hjrose

content: What you are seeing is called Card View, and what you want is called Table View. There is an icon just to the right of the quick filter button that is above the message list pane. Click that and tick 'table view'
creator: davidsk

content:
Sending limits are imposed by your mail provider, not Thunderbird. What the limits are is only knowable with searching 5the term and conditions of the relevant email provider you send through.

Essentially your mail provider is reporting that you have already sent as many mail as you are allowed to. This can be many hundreds of mails in a day or hour, or it might be as few a 1 if you are not authenticating with the server. That is you are not authenticated so your limit is Zero.

Given Google are a huge proportion of the market and you say nothing about who you use. Here are the google limits in case they are the relevant ones https://support.google.com/mail/answer/22839?hl=en
creator: MattAuSupport
